arr.name: dc.description
arr.str: This questionnaire was used to conduct research for a PhD study on the significance of intercultural understanding in the Key Stage 3 MFL curriculum in England. The study explored three perspectives, one of which was the pupil perspective. The pupil perspective was investigated using mixed methods (questionnaire (n=765) and group interviews (n=6)). The research with pupils was concerned with the following questions: - How interesting or enjoyable do pupils perceive their current experience of (inter)cultural aspects of the MFL curriculum? Would a greater emphasis be welcomed? - Do pupils think it is important that school education encourages them to develop openness to other cultures? - Do pupils consider the acquisition of IU beneficial to their (future) lives outside school? - How might pupils' perceptions vary according to gender / socio-economic group / type of school attended? The questionnaire was constructed on the basis of some of the research on motivation in Second Langauge Acquisition in addition to the researcher's extensive professional experience as a MFL secondary school teacher and teacher educator. With hindsight, the researcher would have liked to have included a question about pupils' experiences / level of enjoyment of their CURRENT cultural learning. She would also have liked to have asked whether this learning took place in English or the target language.
